Raw Institutional Statement: Except as provided herein, no person may propagate, sell, broker, trade or transport or attempt to propagate, sell, broker, or transport any live fish or viable gametes unless the aquaculture facility which said person operates first obtains an aquaculture permit as provided  in these rules
aIm: propagate, sell, broker, trade or transport or attempt to propagate, sell, broker, or transport

Raw Institutional Statement: A broker that never takes physical possession of said live fish and viable gametes shall not be required to have an aquaculture permit
oBject: A broker that never takes physical possession of said live fish and viable gametes

Raw Institutional Statement: A person who only sells directly to individuals, for use as food, live fish from a holding tank that is not hydrologically connected to the waters of the state, and who does not propagate, transport, or release live fish into the waters of the state, shall not be required to have an aquaculture facility permit.
oBject:
A person who only sells directly to individuals, for use as food, live fish from a holding tank that is not hydrologically connected to the waters of the state, and who does not
propagate, transport, or release live fish into the waters of the state

Raw Institutional Statement: A bait dealer shall not be required to have an aquaculture facility permit if all the live fish and viable gametes the dealer sells are obtained:  a. From a source that has been inspected and certified free of disease in accordance with Division regulations and policies, and b. Records are maintained and receipts provided to customers as required in section VI.E.
No aquaculture facility permit shall be required for persons exempted from such requirement by sections 35-24.5-109(5) and (6), C.R.S.
oBject: persons exempted from such requirement by sections 35-24.5-109(5) and (6), C.R.S.

Raw Institutional Statement: No aquaculture facility permit shall be required to transport legally obtained live fish or gametes for non-commercial personal use or consumption so long as such live fish or gametes are not released into the waters of the state.
oBject: [persons who have live fish or gametes not intended for commerical use]

Raw Institutional Statement: Non-compliance with the provisions of this rule constitutes grounds for denial, suspension or revocation of an  aquaculture facility permit pursuant to the provisions of §35-24.5-110, C.R.S.
oBject: grounds for denial, suspension, or revocaction of an aquaculture facility permit

Raw Institutional Statement: Any permittee whose permit is denied, suspended, or revoked, by the Commissioner shall lawfully dispose of all live fish and viable gametes held pursuant to the permit in the manner and within the time period ordered by the Commissioner.
Attribute: Any permittee whose permit is denied, suspended, or revoked by the Commissioner
oBject: live fish and viable gametes held

Raw Institutional Statement: Except as otherwise prohibited by law, a permittee may sell, trade, transport or broker live fish or  viable gametes...for the purposes of propagating, selling, trading or transporting live fish or viable gametes.
Except as otherwise prohibited by law, a permittee may...operate a fish production facility for the purposes of propagating, selling, trading or transporting live fish or viable gametes.
Several satellite stations of a fish production facility may operate under one aquaculture facility permit provided all such satellite stations are listed on such permit.
oBject: several satellite stations of a fish production facility

Raw Institutional Statement: All production facilities that sell or stock live fish shall obtain an annual fish health inspection performed by a qualified fish pathologist in accordance with Division regulations and policies.
Attribute: All production facilities that sell or stock live fish

Raw Institutional Statement: Applicants for an aquaculture facility permit and renewal of a permit shall apply for required permits on forms provided by the Department accompanied by funds in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00).
Attribute: Applicants for an aquaculture facility permit and renewal of a permit

Raw Institutional Statement: Each applicant shall submit a signed, complete, accurate, and legible application.
oBject: a signed, ccomplete, accurate, and legible application

Raw Institutional Statement: An additional fee is not required to amend a permit (i.e., add more species).
oBject: additional fee to amend a permit (i.e., add more species)

Raw Institutional Statement: Aquaculture facility permits are non-transferable…
...[Aquaculture facility permits] and shall expire December thirty-first (31) of each year.
Condition: December thirty-first (31) of each year

Raw Institutional Statement: Applications for renewal of an aquaculture facility permit shall be postmarked on or before December 31 of the year preceding the year for which renewal is sought.
oBject: Applications for renewal of an aquaculture facility permit
Condition: on or before December 31 of the year preceding the year for which renewal is sought

Raw Institutional Statement: Applicants shall list the species of fish they intend to possess.
oBject: species of dfish they intend to possess

Raw Institutional Statement: A Division employee shall make a personal inspection of the applicant's facilities when considering an initial application to determine compliance with these regulations.

An aquaculture facility permit shall not be issued for waters that have been stocked with fish at public expense within five (5) years prior to application unless: (a) all fish stocked in such waters have been removed or eliminated (e.g., by winter kill) or (b) the applicant has negotiated with the Division for purchase or salvage of state-stocked fish.
Condition: for waters that have been stocked with fish at public expense within five (5) years prior to application unless: (a) all fish stocked in such waters have been removed or eliminated (e.g., by winter kill) or (b) the applicant has negotiated with the Division for purchase or salvage of state-stocked fish

Raw Institutional Statement: All waters shall be equipped with screening installations, if necessary, to prevent fish in public waters or private lakes from entering the permitted production facilities or lake(s), or prevent fish in the permitted production facilities or lake(s) from entering public waters.

An application for an aquaculture facility permit issuance or renewal may be denied in its  entirety or limited as to species authorized to be kept if necessary to protect Colorado's wildlife resources or cultured aquatic stock from a negative impact such as: a. Potential habitat competition, damage or destruction. b. Disruption of migration, breeding, or rearing and survival of young. c. Predation. d. Danger to humans, domestic livestock or property. e. Disease.
oBject: application for an aquaculture facility permit or renewal

Raw Institutional Statement: An aquaculture facility permit shall not be denied, however, for species endemic to the local area of the facility, or for species generally accepted as not having negative impact to wildlife resources.
Condition: however, for species endemic to the local area of the facility, or for species generally  accepted as not having negative impact to wildlife resources

Raw Institutional Statement: Written notification of denial shall be furnished to the applicant stating the reasons for denial within sixty (60) days of the receipt of a sufficient application.
Condition: to the applicant stating the reasons for denial within sixty (60) days of the receipt of a sufficient application

Raw Institutional Statement: Review of a denial shall be in accordance with section 24-4-104 & 105, C.R.S.
oBject: review of a denial [of an aquaculture facility permit]
Condition: with section 24-4-104 & 105, C.R.S.

Raw Institutional Statement: The permitee shall allow the inspection of fish or viable gametes by persons authorized by the Commissioner to enforce these regulations, at any reasonable time.
oBject: inspection of fish or viable gametes
Condition: by persons authorized by the Commissioner to enforce these regulations, at any reasonable time

Raw Institutional Statement: Records required by these regulations shall be made available to such authorized Department or Division employees during regular business hours.
Condition: to such authorized Department of Division employees during regular business hours

Raw Institutional Statement: All aquaculture facility permitees shall maintain records documenting the acquisition of fish and viable gametes.
oBject: records documenting the acquistion of fish and viable gametes

Raw Institutional Statement: The records shall show the name and address of the business or person from whom such fish and viable gametes were obtained, their date of acquisition, and their species, number and size.
oBject: name and address of the business or person from whom such fish and viable gametes were obtained, their date of inspection, and their species, number and size

Raw Institutional Statement: All records shall be retained for the period of ownership of the fish  or viable gametes and for three (3) years after disposition.
Condition: for the period of ownership of the fish or viable gametes and for three (3) years after disposition

Raw Institutional Statement: When live fish or viable gametes are sold, traded, taken or otherwise disposed of from an aquaculture facility, the permittee or operator shall, at the time of transfer of possession, give an invoice to the person receiving such fish or viable gametes.
Such invoice [given to person receiving fish or gametes that have been sold, traded or taken from an aquaculture facility at the time of a transfer] shall contain the permittee's name…

...and such invoice shall show the name and address of the recipient, the license number or designation of the receiving facility or lake, date of delivery, species, number and size of the fish or viable gametes.
oBject: the name and address of the recipient, the license number or designation of the receiving facility or lake, date of delivery, species, number and size of the fish or viable gametes
Condition: [where] in such invoice

Raw Institutional Statement: Copies of all invoices for aquaculture facility permits shall be maintained by the permitee for three (3) years.
Condition: by the permittee for three (3) years

Raw Institutional Statement: All original records must be kept at the same location as the production facility or satellite location or at the Colorado address of the permitee.
Condition: at the same location as the production facility or satellite location ar at the Colorado address of the permittee

Raw Institutional Statement: Bait dealers that are exempt from the aquaculture facility permit requirement pursuant to section  II of these rules shall be required to: 1. Maintain records of all acquisitions of live fish or viable gametes…2. Provide each purchaser of live fish or viable gametes with a written receipt stating the seller’s name, the date of sale, and the species, and the number sold.
Attribute: Bait dealers that are exempt from the aquaculture facility permit requirement pursuant to section  II of these rules
oBject: records of all acquisitions of live fish or viable gametes

Raw Institutional Statement: Bait dealers that are exempt from the aquaculture facility permit requirement pursuant to section  II of these rules shall be required to: 2. Provide each purchaser of live fish or viable gametes with a written receipt stating the seller’s name, the date of sale, and the species, and the number sold.
Attribute: Bait dealers that are exempt from the aquaculture facility permit requirement pursuant to section  II of these rules
oBject: each purchaser of live fish or viable gametes
Condition: [how] with a written receipt stating the seller's name, the date of sale, the species, and the numbers sold

Raw Institutional Statement: ...The records shall show the name and address of the business or person from whom such fish and viable  gametes were obtained, their date of acquisition, and their species, number and size…
oBject: the name and address of the business or person from whom such fish and viable  gametes were obtained, their date of acquisition, and their species, number and size
Condition: [in] records

Raw Institutional Statement:
In all cases of permitting, taking, possession, importation,
exportation, release, marking and sale of cultured aquatic stock, the most restrictive state or federal law  shall apply.
oBject: most restrictive state or federal law
Condition:
In all cases of permitting, taking, possession, importation,
exportation, release, marking and sale of cultured aquatic stock

Raw Institutional Statement: These rules are adopted pursuant to 35-24.5-105(1) and 35-24.5-106(1).
These recommended changes are the result of a review of the existing regulation by the Colorado Aquaculture Board.
Condition: [from a] review of the existing regulation by the Colorado Aquaculture Board

Raw Institutional Statement: This review resulted in both technical and operational changes being recommended.
oBject: both technical and operational changed being recommended
Condition: [from] this review

Raw Institutional Statement: These amendments to these rules are proposed for adoption by the Commissioner of the Colorado Department of Agriculture (“CDA”) pursuant to his authority under the Aquaculture Act (the “Act”), §35-24.5-107(1)(a),(c), and 5, C.R.S.
Condition: for adoption by the Commissioner of the Colorado Department of Agriculture (“CDA”) pursuant to his authority under the Aquaculture Act (the “Act”), §35-24.5-107(1)(a),(c), and 5, C.R.S.

Raw Institutional Statement: The purpose of these proposed rules is to: 1. Require all fish in Colorado aquaculture holding and aquaculture production facilities to be certified as Viral Hemorrhagic Septicemia (“VHS”)-free in accordance to Colorado Division of Wildlife Chapter 0 Regulations. 2. Reduce the aquaculture facility permit fee from $150.00 to $100.00. 3. Correct several typographical errors, delete obsolete language, and to add a section to contain the statements of basis, specific statutory authority and purpose.
Condition: to: 1. Require all fish in Colorado aquaculture holding and aquaculture production facilities to be certified as Viral Hemorrhagic Septicemia (“VHS”)-free in accordance to Colorado Division of Wildlife Chapter 0 Regulations. 2. Reduce the aquaculture facility permit fee from $150.00 to $100.00. 3. Correct several typographical errors, delete obsolete language, and to add a section to contain the statements of basis, specific statutory authority and purpose.

Raw Institutional Statement: The amendments to these rules are proposed to the Commissioner of the Colorado Department of Agriculture (“Commissioner”) for his adoption pursuant to his authority under the Aquaculture Act (the “Act”), § 35-24.5-107(1) and (5), C.R.S.
Condition: to the Commissioner of the Colorado Department of Agriculture (“Commissioner”) for his adoption pursuant to his authority under the Aquaculture Act (the “Act”), § 35-24.5-107(1) and (5), C.R.S.

Raw Institutional Statement: The purpose of these proposed rules is to: 1. Define “aquaculture facility permit” to comport with the current definition as codified within the Aquaculture Act, § 35-24.5-103(2), C.R.S.
Condition: to 1. Define “aquaculture facility permit” to comport with the current definition as codified within the Aquaculture Act, § 35-24.5-103(2), C.R.S.

Raw Institutional Statement: [The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 2. Define the common, biological term “Gamete(s)” as it specifically relates to fish and aquaculture.
Condition: to 2. Define the common, biological term “Gamete(s)” as it specifically relates to fish and aquaculture

Raw Institutional Statement: [The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 3. Clarify aquaculture facility permitting requirements for the  ollowing groups of persons in the following ways: a. To articulate that a broker who never physically possesses a live fish or viable gamete does not need a permit; b. To create an exemption for those persons who sell live fish to individuals from grocery stores, fish markets, and restaurants, but to maintain the requirement that those who transport live fish to these types of outlets must have a permit; c. To distinguish bait dealers who propagate, transport, or release live fish or viable gametes into state waters from those who do not such that only bait dealers who propagate, transport, or release live fish or viable gametes into state waters need a permit...d. To maintain the exemption from requiring a permit for those who hold live fish or viable gametes in closed aquaria or backyard ponds, including those facilities that are municipal, state, or federal facilities or any accredited zoological garden; and e. To clarify that persons transporting live fish or viable gametes that have been legally obtained for a non-commercial, personal use in aquaria or backyard ponds or as bait do not need a permit.
Condition: to: 3. Clarify aquaculture facility permitting requirements for the  ollowing groups of persons in the following ways: a. To articulate that a broker who never physically possesses a live fish or viable gamete does not need a permit; b. To create an exemption for those persons who sell live fish to individuals from grocery stores, fish markets, and restaurants, but to maintain the requirement that those who transport live fish to these types of outlets must have a permit; c. To distinguish bait dealers who propagate, transport, or release live fish or viable gametes into state waters from those who do not such that only bait dealers who propagate, transport, or release live fish or viable gametes into state waters need a permit...d. To maintain the exemption from requiring a permit for those who hold live fish or viable gametes in closed aquaria or backyard ponds, including those facilities that are municipal, state, or federal facilities or any accredited zoological garden; and e. To clarify that persons transporting live fish or viable gametes that have been legally obtained for a non-commercial, personal use in aquaria or backyard ponds or as bait do not need a permit.

Raw Institutional Statement: ...Those who do not undertake these specified activities do not need such a permit as long as they obtain their live fish and viable gametes from a Division fish health certified source, maintain records of fish acquisition, and provide their customers receipts for sale of live fish and viable gametes...
Attribute: Those who do not undertake these specified activities
Condition: as long as they obtain their live fish and viable gametes from a Division fish health certified source, maintain records of fish acquisition, and provide their customers receipts for sale of live fish and viable gametes

Raw Institutional Statement: [The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 4. To articulate and clarify the results of non-compliance with the provisions of the rule and to allow the Commissioner to set the time limit for disposal of live fish and viable gametes in the event that a permit is denied, suspended, or revoked.
Condition: to 4. To articulate and clarify the results of non-compliance with the provisions of the rule and to allow the Commissioner to set the time limit for disposal of live fish and viable gametes in the event that a permit is denied, suspended, or revoked

Raw Institutional Statement: [The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 5. To establish record-keeping requirements of bait dealers who are exempt from the permitting requirements of the Aquaculture Act.
Condition: to 5. To establish record-keeping requirements of bait dealers who are exempt from the permitting requirements of the Aquaculture Act

Raw Institutional Statement:
[The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 6. To move this rule within the Code of Colorado Regulations from the Markets Division (8 CCR 1204-7) to the Animal Industry Division (8 CCR 1201-21) to reflect a reorganization of the
Aquaculture Act to the Animals Division within the Colorado Department of Agriculture.
Condition:
to 6. To move this rule within the Code of Colorado Regulations from the Markets Division (8 CCR 1204-7) to the Animal Industry Division (8 CCR 1201-21) to reflect a reorganization of the
Aquaculture Act to the Animals Division within the Colorado Department of Agriculture

Raw Institutional Statement: [The purpose of these proposed rules is to:] 7. To make general changes to language within the rule to ensure consistency with the newly proposed definitions, emptions, and other changes.
Condition: to  7. To make general changes to language within the rule to ensure consistency with the newly proposed definitions, emptions, and other changes
